COMPARISON.SIMILARITY: Only supposed to run on devices created by Apple
COMPARISON.DIFFERENCE: iOS runs on mobile devices; MacOs runs on laptops and desktops
iOS mainly runs on devices created by Apple, Android is not targeting specific hardware
Android is opensource, iOS is closed source

COMPARISON.SIMILARITY: Mainly for desktop and laptop computers

COMPARISON.DIFFERENCE: Android is for mobile devices, Linux is mainly used on servers, desktops, and laptops

COMPARISON.COMMENT: Windows and Ubuntu-linux have versions that are for mobile devices.
